titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of Flatbush land lease to the Trustees of the Town of Flatbush 1977.510
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-11T16:11-0500

did.unittitle: Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of Flatbush land lease to the Trustees of the Town of Flatbush
did.abstract: Lease between the Protestant Reformed Dutch Church of Flatbush and the Trustees of the Town of Flatbush, providing for the building and continued use of a common school on church-owned land in Flatbush School District No. 1. The document is dated January 1, 1848.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church (Flatbush, New York, N.Y.).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of Flatbush land lease to the Trustees of the Town of Flatbush, 1977.510, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
